events.name: Google I/O Extended 2017 Bacolod
events.description:
We are pleased to open our sign up for the Google I/O Extended Bacolod 2017. Click on link to register for an invite. 

https://goo.gl/BVT8mJ

* Signing doesn't guarantee an invitation to the event due to the limited number of seats. Only approved invites will be given access to the venue.

* Check your email for confirmation and seat invite starting July 5, 2017.

events.name: Web Study Jam
events.description:
Please register to reserve your seat.

https://goo.gl/Lo8tc9

GDG Bacolod is organising a study jam on mobile site certification. This is a chance to get a professional accreditation that demonstrates you have an understanding of basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. By learning together we think it’s going to be more fun and more of us are going to be able to complete it.

Requirements

You need basic web development skills to take part and it typically it takes 3-4 hours to run through the course materials, followed by a 90 minute multiple choice exam. You can find more details on the course here. It’s possible to do it entirely online alone, but we’d like to run through it together as a group.

Why do it?

There is more traffic to mobile sites than desktop yet most sites don’t provide an effective experience for users. Best practice is changing rapidly so what people may have learned a few years ago may not be up to date. For companies and site owners we see better mobile design leading to significant and measurable improvements in customer acquisition, retention and engagement.

Sounds great, where do I sign up?

Registration on link to reserve your seat. https://goo.gl/Lo8tc9.

events.name: Web Study Jam + WTM

venue.name: University of St La Salle - BACOLOD CITY

events.description:
GDG Bacolod is organising a study jam on mobile site certification. This is a chance to get a professional accreditation that demonstrates you have an understanding of basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. By learning together we think it’s going to be more fun and more of us are going to be able to complete it.

Requirements

You need basic web development skills to take part and it typically it takes 3-4 hours to run through the course materials, followed by a 90 minute multiple choice exam. You can find more details on the course here (https://support.google.com/partners/answer/7358898?hl=en-GB&ref_topic=7359299). It’s possible to do it entirely online alone, but we’d like to run through it together as a group.

Why do it?

There is more traffic to mobile sites than desktop yet most sites don’t provide an effective experience for users. Best practice is changing rapidly so what people may have learned a few years ago may not be up to date. For companies and site owners we see better mobile design leading to significant and measurable improvements in customer acquisition, retention and engagement (https://developers.google.com/web/showcase/).

Google's Women Techmakers program provides visibility, community, and resources for women in technology.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam - GCP Essentials

venue.name: University of St La Salle - BACOLOD CITY

events.description:
This event is intended for beginners with GCP Essentials. If you are already familiar with GCP this event not for you, advance sessions will be scheduled on a later date.

This is a limited seats event and registration will open soon, watch out for it.

-- Reminders --
We will be using an online tool called Qwiklabs, a Google training product. If you have used Qwiklabs before, that's great! Make sure you know your password. If you have never used Qwiklabs before, save time by creating an account for yourself prior to the class at:

https://google.qwiklabs.com/users/sign_up

(creating an account is free).

At the event we will give you a link for free Qwiklabs access.

events.name: I/O Extended / Women Techmakers IamRemarkable Workshop
events.description:
#IamRemarkable is a Google initiative empowering women and underrepresented groups to celebrate their achievements in the workplace and beyond.

This goal is to improve the self promotion motivation and skills of women and underrepresented groups. Challenge the social perception around self promotion. And to encourage more women in technology to be part of this great community.

Registration opening soon! Link will be posted here and on WTM Bacolod Facebook Page.

This is a FREE event but with limited seats.

Women Techmakers Bacolod events will Prioritize but won't be exclusive to Women. Any gender is welcome.

events.name: Machine Learning Workshop for Educators
events.description:
About the Workshop

The 2-day intensive bootcamp aims to help teachers learn basic concepts of Machine Learning thru talks and hands-on activities.

This workshop is for you, if:
- You are a teacher in CS/IT with a strong programming background
- You are familiar with Python
- You know at least a little about linear algebra and calculus.

If your school is interested to join send us an email [masked]

events.name: WTM Public Speaking Workshop
events.description:
Interested participants please fill-up the registration from by this link:

http://bit.ly/publicspeakingwtmbcd

Have you ever been invited to be a speaker once or to conduct a workshop?

Calling all professional individual who wish to inspire others and share their knowledge and skills but doesn't have any idea how to start and what to prepare.

Women Techmakers Bacolod will be conducting a Public Speaking Workshop to help you with your public speaking activity. This activity will not only give you confidence but also a great opportunity for to get tips to be comfortable and a venue for you to answer all your concerns.

This activity encourages Women and is OPEN to ALL genders.

Stay tune for updates and registrations in WTM Bacolod Facebook page.
https://www.facebook.com/wtmbacolod/

This is a free event.

upcoming.name: IWD 2020 - WTM Bacolod
upcoming.description:
International Women’s Day (IWD) is marked on March 8th every year. In different regions, the focus of celebrations ranges from general respect and appreciation toward women to a celebration of women’s economic, political, and social achievements.

Join us as in our local community as we celebrate women's contribution in the field of technology.

This is a free event. All gender are welcome but we more encourage women to join this event.

Registration will be out soon.

Follow us on Facebook for more updates.
https://www.facebook.com/wtmbacolod
